intro: Senecio pseudosylvaticus, commonly known as the African ironweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. It produces small yellow to orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Senecio pseudosylvaticus is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
